page.title: 14COVENTRY AND ASHBY CANAL
page.content: We spent two afternoons walking the canals to discover the farming done in the fields by the canal. We found that many hedges have been removed as we were using a map with the old field boundaries marked on it. Our field was covered in 'spoil' from the quarry and was therfore not farmed. On the other hand some fields which were once quarried, then filled in with rubbish have now been returned to agriculture. Using the old field patterns 1 field was ploughed, 9 fields were growing barley, 15 field were grassed, some having horses and cattle in them. 17 were wheat. Quarring for granite is still done and has caused very large holes in the ground. There is also evidence of disused canals, which in the past have served the mining industries of the area.
